thread.title: Virginia Tech students sang Smash Mouth's 'All-Star' to distract Wisconsin players shooting free throws
thread.title_full: Virginia Tech students sang Smash Mouth's 'All-Star' to distract Wisconsin players shooting free throws

author: Molly Podlesny
title: Virginia Tech students sang Smash Mouth's 'All-Star' to distract Wisconsin players shooting free throws
text:
Somebody once told them this would work.
As Virginia Tech took on Wisconsin Thursday night in the round of 64, Nigel Hayes went to the free throw line. VT students did what they needed to do. (Turn your volume all the way up.)
Virginia Tech student section tries to distract Wisconsin's Nigel Hayes by singing Smash Mouth's "All-Star" pic.twitter.com/OSPNuICm5G 
— gifdsports (@gifdsports) March 17, 2017 They sang “All Star’ by Smash Mouth to distract him from the shot.
Speaking as a person around Nigel’s age, I’d have to say hearing the sweet tones of Smash Mouth, being sung as nicely as these fans did it, would only calm me down. Maybe it even put him in the zone, considering it was released in his formative years.
Ultimately, Wisconsin won, knocking VT out of the tournament.
Maybe next year, Hokies. Until then, keep singing.
